job_title: Center Manager in Rohnert Park, CA
pros: -budget for floor staff is better than most dialysis companies -quality equipment to work with makes the job easier for RNs and Techs than other dialysis companies Nothing else
cons: -upper management and HR are toxic; will commit gross negligence and allow harassment to happen. In fact, they will sometimes join in with the teams and harass you as well. -the company’s mission is based around nurses, however RNs are taught to be left brained. Management is primarily a right brained skill so operationally this company has no idea what they are doing and commit many fraudulent acts and violate workers rights. -treated worse by this company than any other in my life (I thought they would be better being a non profit) Just do yourself a favor and avoid. If I could give negative stars I would

job_title: California Certified Dialysis Technician in Morgan Hill, CA
pros: Very nice floor clinical staff, three day work weeks are flexible for spending time with your family and friends. Decent healthcare package. Some employees are Amazon. Teammates.
cons:
No room for advancement, they will not hire for any upper level positions unless you know someone who is corporate. Big negative for any company. 

The idea of a three day work week that Satellite Healthcare tries to sell to you is a lie. The pay is not enough to live off of. Be prepared to have another job because in this day and age, $22 is kind of a slap in the face for everything g you will be dealing with at Satellite Healthcare. 

I personally get payed $18 after 7 years of employment there. At the time of this review, even $18 is something that still has to be approved by upper management so I will surely be taking them to court over this matter. 

Do not work here if you want to feel like you are making a difference. Patient care is something that should not be taken lightly yet this company makes you feel like cutting corners constantly, which is very unsafe. Give your employees the tools and time we need to give proper, safe patient care.

job_title: Clinical Nurse in San Jose, CA
pros: Overall, positive working environment with great teamwork and morale. Staff are helpful and pleasant to work with! Their training program for nurses new to dialysis is exceptional which encompasses 3 months of clinical and didactic training. Upon completion of the program, nurses are unable to work by themselves until a year (i.e. closing or opening). During didactic training, complementary lunches, snacks, and drinks are provided. The educational staff know what they’re doing! Once you’re done with program, you will be more than prepared to work independently as a floor nurse. They offer excellent packages for health insurance and retirement plans; 6% match after one year of employment, free dental, health savings account, PPO, HMO, etcetera. Employee referrals pay out hefty bonuses. Employees receive $75 dollars a year for work attire. Sign on bonuses upon hire.
cons: Pay could be more competitive in comparison to cost of living, clinical nurses should be compensated for their certifications, continuing education, and how well they performed during clinical and didactic. Re-evaluation of their pay rate should be completed after completion of their program. After all, a nurse with x amount of years of experience doesn’t mean they’re going to perform better than a nurse with no work experience.

job_title: Acute Dialysis RN in Austin, TX
pros: Great pay and benefits for a non-profit, SatelliteAcutes app is very intuitive and easy to use, $20/mo. cellphone reimbursement, mileage reimbursement traveling between hospitals. Since there's only 3 hospitals the program covers it is much more manageable to staff. Schedulers will generally send you to the same hospital closest to your location so it is relatively convenient to get to. Generous tuition reimbursement, bonuses during Christmas time, and ideal for training and advancement in the dialysis field.  Very knowledgeable and friendly techs.
cons: High turnover with management, not at all a secret that program is disorganized, no self-scheduling, being full-time means 3 patients/day (so 18+ hours a day in the hospital can get extremely tiresome!).  Chronically understaffed, so being on-call essentially means you have to dialyze patients VERY late at night that nobody else could cover

review_title: Tons of issues, and they won't be fixed because corporate is blind to the antics of their regional managers.
job_title: CMA/AC/AA in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Constantly told how great I am at my job. And how much I accomplish with no training from corporate. Praised by clinic manager and corporate as a skilled and experienced tech.
cons: I won't advance in the company because regional managers won't pay a livable wage. I work over 40 hours weekly and still cant afford a studio apartment. I currently am doing 3 people's job.

review_title: Overall company is okay... A lot of turnover. There is room for advancement but it takes a long time. Pay is not good.
job_title: Home Therapies Nurse in Emeryville, CA
pros: Good coworkers, good hours for the home programs because no weekend (unless you are on call), no work on national holidays.
cons: No generalized base rate of pay and not the same pay increase throughout company. I started here with some nursing experience but base rate of pay is low, where other clinic pay was at a decent 42 with lesser experienced nurse. Salary increase per year is only at about 2% which was not even $1.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
